document.title: Mathematics Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

FCC9B2D99F3E4B75BCFA4013B07331B8.description: Calculate and verify permutations and combinations using technology.

FD638431CC1849B39130BB3EA2F96407.description: Use permutations and combinations as counting techniques to solve contextual problems.

C64B5EF3F2C84A529D9562A2AD284C18.description: Calculate the number of combinations of n objects taken r at a time.

2F4B44C60E2843569566920A715C9BD3.description: Calculate the number of permutations of n objects taken r at a time.

5429F376CA354A27A600706879C2BBCF.description:
Compare and contrast permutations and combinations to count the number of ways that events
can occur.

65210ABB6AFD4B8F806301C98C338800.description: The student will compute and distinguish between permutations and combinations.

002179D47DE341BC81F14CBEC75B29D3.description: Evaluate the reasonableness of a mathematical model of a contextual situation.

04EAEFD73B924C97B60B5C4BB43BA536.description:
Make predictions, decisions, and critical judgments using data, scatterplots, or the equation(s)
of the mathematical model.

D3F4D7B670B44F36B5CF706491FF7D11.description:
Use the correlation coefficient to designate the goodness of fit of a linear function using
technology.

ABC76A37069642CB9DA82198AC872B07.description:
Determine the equation(s) of the function(s) that best models the relationship between two
variables using technology. Curves of best fit may include a combination of linear, quadratic,
or exponential (piecewise-defined) functions.

E25492D20B864DE09E77966E17758207.description:
Determine whether the relationship between two quantitative variables is best approximated
by a linear, quadratic, exponential, or a combination of these functions.

3502109BEBAC441FA61252EB1895FD13.description: Represent bivariate data with a scatterplot using technology.

7A6BB4CB6C9D45CD93ACC8D99167D3EB.description:
Collect or acquire bivariate data through research, or using surveys, observations, scientific
experiments, polls, or questionnaires.

D1E3C96CBDFD43F88E06DFE298DBFC06.description:
Formulate investigative questions that require the collection or acquisition of bivariate data
and investigate questions using a data cycle.

3EC44ACAC00B473A95972147B5931B1B.description:
The student will apply the data cycle (formulate questions; collect or acquire data;
organize and represent data; and analyze data and communicate results) with a focus
on representing bivariate data in scatterplots and determining the curve of best fit
using linear, quadratic, exponential, or a combination of these functions.

AFEDE9308586415EB79C457D3ADA924B.description:
Compare multiple data distributions using measures of center, measures of spread, and shape
of the distributions.

93E4F70ABCD74E539DEDF47E5BF386D1.description: Apply the Empirical Rule to answer investigative questions.

C4B7987365D14A618D8181F84C5BA469.description:
Determine the solution to problems involving the relationship of the mean, standard deviation,
and z-score of a data set represented by a smooth or normal curve.

1C45721C24684415A1CDD832C3066820.description: Compare two data points from two different distributions using z-scores.

6311B25D2C784B0492CC7CE4034CE08A.description: Calculate and interpret the z-score for a value in a data set.

12D1CE5553A241948FBB57583416CD5E.description:
Describe and interpret a data distribution represented by a smooth curve by analyzing
measures of center, measures of spread, and shape of the curve.

78332AE16C7E41559B211A6623A1D39B.description: Identify the properties of a normal distribution.

8D22EE4A04EA4B2E93141EF11EC532C0.description:
Examine the shape of a data set (skewed versus symmetric) that can be represented by a
histogram, and sketch a smooth curve to model the distribution.

70B4EB9B70CA422AB96D49EE66FB158A.description:
Collect or acquire univariate data through research, or using surveys, observations, scientific
experiments, polls, or questionnaires.

D69ADF5F337E4B6A8D9A408093FA1D2E.description:
Formulate investigative questions that require the collection or acquisition of a large set of
univariate quantitative data or summary statistics of a large set of univariate quantitative data
and investigate questions using a data cycle.

8A67CD94B2AA42D78AB063AF8F5F5721.description:
The student will apply the data cycle (formulate questions; collect or acquire data;
organize and represent data; and analyze data and communicate results) with a focus
on univariate quantitative data represented by a smooth curve, including a normal
curve.

CFC1002CCB4141D1968720F2E29715A9.description: Determine the composition of two functions algebraically and graphically.

68A049017A1647109868082602B4C211.description: Graph the inverse of a function as a reflection over the line y = x.

A5222A29969B456FA7885BC27DA4691E.description:
Determine the inverse of a function algebraically and graphically, given the equation of a
linear or quadratic function (linear, quadratic, and square root). Justify and explain why two
functions are inverses of each other.

7E0990D7C34642C3B5AC893C81A33C64.description:
Determine the equations of any vertical and horizontal asymptotes of a function using a graph
or equation (rational, exponential, and logarithmic).

F4A063CA558648E09E3344FCB8B61C21.description: Describe the end behavior of a function.

E29BA281AA7040AEAB25904C7D3F8992.description:
For any value, x, in the domain of f, determine f(x) using a graph or equation. Explain the
meaning of x and f(x) in context, where applicable.

78A2304ACE5B4376AC3AF1F9F7E0483B.description:
Determine the location and value of relative (local) maxima or relative (local) minima of a
function.

D3A281E109EB47A388144B2421FA9080.description:
Determine the location and value of absolute (global) maxima and absolute (global) minima
of a function.

C6AE938D077A4F469D2F8681B6F31DD4.description:
Determine the intervals on which the graph of a function is increasing, decreasing, or
constant.

A5C96AA6ADBB4404BBA1259F23275F4E.description:
Compare and contrast the characteristics of square root, cube root, rational, polynomial,
exponential, logarithmic, and piecewise-defined functions.

F1A251A618AE423CAC721600B5BE4C18.description:
Determine and identify the domain, range, zeros, and intercepts of a function presented
algebraically or graphically, including graphs with discontinuities.

71AD97C7D30D4AED8987CEBB30FF6E38.description:
The student will investigate and analyze characteristics of square root, cube root,
rational, polynomial, exponential, logarithmic, and piecewise-defined functions
algebraically and graphically.

EE8C63089A2F49E0A1313728DFCBDF51.description:
Compare and contrast the graphs, tables, and equations of square root, cube root, rational,
exponential, and logarithmic functions.

6CCFED116D8641A6886AAF8BBDEB043C.description:
Determine when two variables are directly proportional, inversely proportional, or neither,
given a table of values. Write an equation and create a graph to represent a direct or inverse
variation, including situations in context.

A57270B263B449E1A310AC8E8BE8B0A9.description:
Graph a square root, cube root, rational, exponential, and logarithmic function, given the
equation, using transformations of the parent function including f(x) + k; f(kx); f(x + k); and
kf(x), where k is limited to rational values. Use technology to verify transformations of the
functions.

741C668046ED4D0CBFE0025BDF3BE9A2.description:
Write the equation of a square root, cube root, rational, exponential, and logarithmic function,
given a graph, using transformations of the parent function, including
f(x) + k; f(kx); f(x + k); and kf(x), where k is limited to rational values. Transformations of
exponential and logarithmic functions, given a graph, should be limited to a single
transformation.

559F4628013A488BBE8DD6C88AA5276D.description:
Distinguish between the graphs of parent functions for square root, cube root, rational,
exponential, and logarithmic function families.

33B84388890C46CC88933433D3C0CEB6.description:
The student will investigate, analyze, and compare square root, cube root, rational,
exponential, and logarithmic function families, algebraically and graphically, using
transformations.

8C1AD900AD5148EBBF68AECC912F58E6.description:
Verify possible solution(s) to polynomial equations of degree three or higher algebraically,
graphically, and with technology to justify the reasonableness of answer(s). Explain the
solution method and interpret solutions in context.

EBB72778C47646D6AEF50AC6AAA46A78.description: Solve a polynomial equation over the set of complex numbers.

1BBB2681E0834933A603DF0BD97A58A1.description:
Determine the number and type of solutions (real or imaginary) of a polynomial equation of
degree three or higher.

DF4DF8E06E0D460C965C6DD4354C3F8A.description:
Determine a factored form of a polynomial equation, of degree three or higher, given its zeros
or the x-intercepts of the graph of its related function.

E369B2C038AA413E861D669DBBB23037.description: The student will represent, solve, and interpret the solution to a polynomial equation.

6B3805AA42B545DAB3550DCAAA88CBD6.description: Justify why a possible solution to an equation with a square root might be extraneous.

3458E6180F1947898127C574BEE5E087.description:
Verify possible solution(s) to radical equations algebraically, graphically, and with
technology, to justify the reasonableness of answer(s). Explain the solution method and
interpret solutions for problems given in context.

496579DAFB7A4F7091697926B90DA3BC.description:
Solve an equation containing no more than one radical expression algebraically and
graphically.

327D8D30934649569810DC62D6CF5395.description:
The student will represent, solve, and interpret the solution to an equation containing
a radical expression.

D24DABBA8D8F463C9586059952569177.description:
Justify why a possible solution to an equation containing a rational expression might be
extraneous.

DC0E385698DF4EC48FF1CDFA358F193D.description:
Verify possible solution(s) to rational equations algebraically, graphically, and with
technology to justify the reasonableness of answer(s). Explain the solution method and
interpret solutions for problems given in context.

9AC590CC30624107BB4CB85E6EC5A63E.description:
Solve rational equations with real solutions containing factorable algebraic expressions
algebraically and graphically. Algebraic expressions should be limited to linear and quadratic
expressions.

5A7EDDD84D144D759DAF39C56988F21B.description: Create an equation containing a rational expression to model a contextual situation.

F507AD6923D14BB79E243447DE46B8F6.description:
The student will represent, solve, and interpret the solution to an equation containing
rational algebraic expressions.

3DCE5DC8926A40B48EA822522D91C1D5.description:
Verify possible solution(s) to linear-quadratic or quadratic-quadratic system of equations
algebraically, graphically, and with technology to justify the reasonableness of answer(s).
Explain the solution method and interpret solutions for problems given in context.

E93996EA3B0A4986B76D5E939ADC5D9E.description:
Solve a linear-quadratic and quadratic-quadratic system of equations algebraically and
graphically, including situations in context.

78240EDBCB3F4854B0F26D2E5176D378.description:
Determine the number of solutions to a linear-quadratic and quadratic-quadratic system of
equations in two variables.

65CC296DE549407EA4002D4E5D33385B.description:
Create a linear-quadratic or quadratic-quadratic system of equations to model a contextual
situation.

606B05DDB17C43BDB4984591B36F74B0.description:
The student will solve a system of equations in two variables containing a quadratic
expression.

11E95BEF45D14DA88693055FCE0E9D26.description:
Verify possible solution(s) to quadratic equations or inequalities in one variable algebraically,
graphically, and with technology to justify the reasonableness of answer(s). Explain the
solution method and interpret solutions for problems given in context.

B0CC283924864651B0E11414EFD86433.description:
Determine the solution to a quadratic inequality in one variable over the set of real numbers
algebraically.

BEB096EC92B242668DE7E48BBB7D6BB9.description: Solve a quadratic equation in one variable over the set of complex numbers algebraically.

AFD850C91DB542CD871E974F9CC3E29E.description: Create a quadratic equation or inequality in one variable to model a contextual situation.

B21065474DDB4503918D6FB0542AE274.description:
The student will represent, solve, and interpret the solution to quadratic equations in
one variable over the set of complex numbers and solve quadratic inequalities in one
variable.

27114E4FDE8242DD94577387B8697CC2.description:
Verify possible solution(s) to absolute value equations and inequalities in one variable
algebraically, graphically, and with technology to justify the reasonableness of answer(s).
Explain the solution method and interpret solutions for problems given in context.

F7951E2BE6F34C5088DB254C64CB0F26.description:
Solve an absolute value inequality in one variable and represent the solution set using set
notation, interval notation, and using a number line.

FEE8174FB78D44D697486F70E5C2DDBA.description: Create an absolute value inequality in one variable to model a contextual situation.

5DB3C7B7791C45DD84A2B81E66E6F2C3.description:
Solve an absolute value equation in one variable algebraically and verify the solution
graphically.

B7A3385A9A524992900E0A182FF9F527.description: Create an absolute value equation in one variable to model a contextual situation.

C685888B6B0346B181E198B71AB8B56F.description:
The student will represent, solve, and interpret the solution to absolute value equations
and inequalities in one variable.

401709D336424853BB246C18B8DAC630.description: Apply properties to add, subtract, and multiply complex numbers.

8DFA5E8CC29A45978F42185C7E1AC134.description:
Identify equivalent radical expressions containing negative rational numbers and expressions
in a + bi form.

1516C7CB925844CA93F3CEAA9B73F137.description: The student will perform operations on complex numbers.

2EB7ED43A09B46CE8FBF1271CB259F92.description:
Represent and demonstrate equality of polynomial expressions written in different forms and
verify polynomial identities including the difference of squares, sum and difference of cubes,
and perfect square trinomials.

97FF3A2854084CA39147067E4FC2611D.description:
Determine the quotient of polynomials in one and two variables, using monomial, binomial,
and factorable trinomial divisors.

2B2E4560167E48CB939E62F4A7D96696.description:
Factor polynomials completely in one and two variables with no more than four terms over
the set of integers.

2F795B53214A4FE2A8E6A0D4B149DC71.description: Determine sums, differences, and products of polynomials in one and two variables.

81BA477D2EE44A318F0E47AB4837BD99.description:
The student will perform operations on polynomial expressions and factor polynomial
expressions in one and two variables.

4A5A414100CC4FDB99001DAA746E0A4A.description: Convert between radical expressions and expressions containing rational exponents.

90E1EB96CF2540C4AB6BB764AC674D5A.description:
Add, subtract, multiply, and divide radical expressions that include numeric and algebraic
radicands, simplifying the result. Simplification may include rationalizing the denominator.

EB74ED2BFDA2421F875E001C14B097FB.description:
Simplify and determine equivalent radical expressions that include numeric and algebraic
radicands.

B4A9AAD55013465B9E4D18D80E3AC781.description: The student will perform operations on and simplify radical expressions.

3C245CF009214104BBA95BCBC4CD7AAB.description: Represent and demonstrate equivalence of rational expressions written in different forms.

FA63906B7AD0464392670AFF8FF79239.description:
Recognize a complex algebraic fraction and simplify it as a product or quotient of simple
algebraic fractions.

528D696432764B8F84E35CE21F8DD26C.description:
Justify and determine equivalent rational algebraic expressions with monomial and binomial
factors. Algebraic expressions should be limited to linear and quadratic expressions.

FBD34167BDA649FE84B061C234723C30.description: Add, subtract, multiply, or divide rational algebraic expressions, simplifying the result.

A50B33C79C914A7E88F8C10F3FBE4574.description: The student will perform operations on and simplify rational expressions.
